subject: Programming
title: Queues and First In First Out
description: A quick win: understand Queues and First In First Out.

hook.text: A queue is a line at a coffee shop. First person in line gets served first. Fair and orderly.

buildup.text: Enqueue adds to the back. Dequeue removes from the front. Both happen in constant time.

discovery.text: Print jobs, web server requests, and message systems all use queues to process work fairly.

twist.text: Priority queues break the fairness rule â€” urgent items jump ahead. Emergency rooms work this way.

climax.text: Queues turn chaos into order. Whenever work arrives faster than it's processed, a queue manages the flow.

punchline.text: First in, first out keeps everything fair.

quiz.question: What real-world system uses a queue?
